definition: to chase women/to express oneself in a pompous flowery style

sentences.english: Some girls are coaxed into it by boy friends, or lure into it by predators.
sentences.chinese: 有些女孩这么做或受男朋友哄骗，或受猎艳者引诱。

sentences.english: Provide a connection for hooking up to a portable filtration unit.
sentences.chinese: 提供一个连接到一个便携式猎艳过滤装置。

sentences.english: She didn’t want him to stray, to find his adventure elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 她不希望他分神去别处猎艳。

sentences.english: Victor is a fortune hunter form Quebec.
sentences.chinese: 维克托是来自魁北克猎艳老手。

sentences.english: It's unfortunate some people find intimacy in all the wrong places.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是有些人却在错误的场合猎艳。

sentences.english: There are a lots of men cruising the park.
sentences.chinese: 有很多人在公园里猎艳。

definition: lit. to enjoy the beautiful spring scenery (idiom)/fig. to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
to fondle the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
(slang) (of women) to hunt for rich, attractive guys
lit. to pick the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/fig. to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
to pick up girls/to play around with girls/to chase after girls
to cheat on one's spouse/to have an affair
to carry on a clandestine love affair
